node.title: Fisherman charged with stealing shark detection tag from great white
node.alt: A great white shark with a hook in its mouth.
node.description: A West Australian man accused of stealing a detection tag from a white pointer he caught off the state's south coast has denied the charge.
node.content:
["An Albany man accused of stealing a detection tag from a white shark off Western Australia's south coast has pleaded not guilty to the charge.", "Former commercial fisherman Gregory Mark Sharp, 48, from Kalgan in the south coast town, appeared in Albany Magistrates Court today\u00a0charged with stealing.", "Prosecutors allege he removed the acoustic monitoring device\u00a0after\u00a0accidentally catching the predator while fishing.", "He is accused of using the tag to set off acoustic shark detection buoys in Albany waters seven times between August and September.\u00a0", "", "
Albany fisherman Greg Sharp in 2016.(ABC Rural: Michelle Stanley)
", "Sharp pleaded guilty to charges of possessing\u00a03.2 grams of cannabis and drug paraphernalia\u00a0found during a search relating to the shark tag.", "He was fined $750.", "Sharp will appear in Albany District Court for a trial on the stealing charge in March."]
